name: Halfling Undeath - Fighter 20 Bard 4 Pale Master 16
author: Dante2377

posts.author: Dante2377
posts.content:
So here's a build I posted in another thread that I've run on several servers when I needed to solo certain bosses.  This is a straight up tank - wade in and obstruct enemies from the rest of the party.  You have the AB to keep them focusd on you.  This is also a reasonable soloing combat build.  

I'm posting it here to get any last minute feedback before posting it to the level 40 section.  

The environment it's designed for are mid- or high-magic servers where you can get some damage bonuses on weapons (think Kharlindale or higher, basically +5 or better).  Like most dexers, this would probably be slow going solo on a low-magic world, especially with a -1 STR modifier.  I wouldn't play it there.  

Pros:

Good AB despite 16 PM levels
reasonable melee HP
Excellent AC
Ability to switch between single and dual wield (typically I dual-wielded vs mobs and shield vs bosses)
Great Reflex save and good fort save

Cons
20% xp penalty from level 4
mediocre Will save
no combat options beyond melee

If you don't like the XP Penalty, you could go human (and get 43 more skill points and a feat), but that's going to cost you 2 AB and AC (1 for the starting DEX at 18 instead of 20 and 1 for small size modifier going away).  

There were a lot of builds in the old archives with this class mix, but almost all of them were strength builds, were flat out not good, or both.  There was 1 dex build similar, Nimble Pale Master (Ftr12 bard4 PM24), but despite having 4 more PM AC, it's only a net of 1 AC better and gives up 5 AB and the saves are worse (25/20/29 vs 29/22/35).  It's an older not quite optimized elf build from 2007.  

Also taking suggestions for a better title for the build.  

Dante

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
That's a quite an impressive AB for a PM tank you have there, Dante.  Halfling is a great choice towards that end and one I had not considered.  If you haven't checked it yet, Kail's Human Deathkiss revolves around this same concept.

Considering that bard's UMD always bypasses the scroll check with a single point in UMD, perhaps you might consider reducing the level to a point where you can just use it for the class-specific gear that appeals to you.  I would have explored combining the "convenience" skills with the excess Spellcraft and whatever UMD you can spare and invest in Taunt.  Something about a possible AB of 52 seems appealing to me.  I see 5disable + 4locks + 4spcr +1spare + as much as can be spared from UMD... available.  The only other possibility (I haven't tried to work it out myself, obviously) is to boost INT to 16 by sacrificing one AB & one AC with the prospect of increasing AB by the +6.

Think about it.  This is really an outstanding concept you've devised so once it's been tested to work out the hidden bugs, it would be a good candidate for the completed section.

BTW, if you are having trouble reformatting your post (I suspect the paste function went berzerk), let me know and I can fix it up for you.

Title?  Dunno.  Something along the lines of "Stoneblade" to infer an inpenetrable entity with nasty, spinning kukris?  or "Lil' Stoneblade" for the halfling aspect?  First thought that came to mind.
